ai_answers.explanation: VPC endpoint for DynamoDB ensures traffic stays within AWS network and provides secure access without needing internet gateway or NAT.
DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) provides microsecond latency for read-intensive workloads without application reconfiguration and minimal operational overhead.
AWS Backup provides centralized backup management for both EC2 and RDS with cross-region capabilities and minimal operational overhead.
Create IAM role with Parameter Store read access and KMS decrypt permissions, then attach to EC2 instance for secure parameter retrieval.
AWS Shield Advanced protects against sophisticated DDoS attacks on NLB, while AWS WAF on API Gateway protects against web exploits like SQL injection.
Amazon SQS provides reliable, decoupled communication for microservices with built-in ordering guarantees and fault tolerance for sequential processing.
RDS MySQL with Multi-AZ provides synchronous replication to a standby instance in different AZ, ensuring every transaction is stored on two nodes.
Serverless architecture with S3, API Gateway, Lambda, and DynamoDB with auto-scaling minimizes server maintenance while providing rapid scaling.
Lambda functions must run in VPC with appropriate security groups to access resources in private subnets through Direct Connect.
Create IAM role with S3 permissions and specify as taskRoleArn in ECS task definition for secure access without hardcoded credentials.
Read replica offloads reporting queries from primary database, eliminating timeouts during order processing while maintaining data consistency.
Amazon Textract extracts medical information from documents, while S3 + Athena provides scalable storage and SQL querying capabilities.
ElastiCache for Redis provides in-memory caching to reduce database reads while maintaining high availability with cluster mode.
Deploy database across two AZs with replication and automatic failover configuration for high availability in same region.
SQS queue provides durable message storage and Auto Scaling processes messages reliably, preventing order loss during failures.
DynamoDB TTL automatically deletes old items based on timestamp attribute, minimizing cost and development effort for data lifecycle management.
Elastic Beanstalk supports .NET with minimal changes for high availability, while DMS migrates Oracle to RDS Oracle in Multi-AZ.
EKS with Fargate provides managed Kubernetes without infrastructure overhead, DocumentDB offers MongoDB compatibility with minimal operational overhead.
Amazon Transcribe provides speaker recognition and transcription, while Athena enables SQL queries on transcript files stored in S3.
Amazon Cognito user pool authorizer in API Gateway provides AWS managed authentication with least operational overhead.
SQS queue buffers writes to DynamoDB during high throughput periods, preventing data loss and providing better availability.
Two SQS queues decouple order collection and fulfillment processes, allowing independent scaling based on queue depth metrics.
Route 53 multivalue answer routing distributes traffic randomly, while launching instances across two AZs ensures fault tolerance.
AWS SCT converts Oracle schema to PostgreSQL, while DMS with memory-optimized instance handles high read/write workload during migration.
CloudWatch metric stream with Kinesis Data Firehose provides serverless, real-time data delivery to S3 without affecting EC2 launch speed.
